org.xlattice.node

Class Configurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.node.Configurer

  • public class Configurer
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads the Node's configuration file, parses it, and creates the Node. In its current incarnation, the configuration file is an XML file following this form: 
       <node>
     <nodeID>... base-64 encoded value ... </nodeID>
     <rsa>
       <p>PPPPPPPPPPPPP</p>
       <q>QQQQQQQQQQQQQ</q>
       <d>DDDDDDDDDDDDD</d>
       <e>EEEEEEEEEEEEE</e>
     </rsa>
     <overlays>
       <overlay dir="dirName" class="org.xlattice.overlays.CLASSNAME" />
       <overlay dir="dirName" class="org.xlattice.overlays.CLASSNAME" />
       ...
    </overlays>
  </node>
    The node ID and RSA n and d key values are base-64 encoded. e is commonly one of 3, 17, or 65537. n (which together with e is the public key) and d are typically quite large but nevertheless are encoded without line breaks. If n is a 1024 bit value, 128 bytes, its base64-encoded equivalent occupies 172 bytes.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon
